thread.title: ESPN analyst says Isaiah Briscoe has important role
thread.title_full: ESPN analyst says Isaiah Briscoe has important role

title: ESPN analyst says Isaiah Briscoe has important role
text:
ESPN analyst says Isaiah Briscoe has important role Kentucky sophomore Isaiah Briscoe can be a huge player for the Wildcats moving forward. Slot to Kentucky Links ESPN analyst Seth Greenberg said Sunday that Kentucky sophomore Isaiah Briscoe needs to get back to what he does well. 
Isiah Briscoe needs to get back to what makes him different. Be a great defender, slasher and secondary rebounder. He has an important role — Seth Greenberg (@SethOnHoops) February 19, 2017 Briscoe is averaging 13.6 points, 5.4 rebounds and 4.3 assists this season, and he’s shown dramatic improvement as a shooter. But he struggled at Georgia, shooting 4-of-12 with five fouls and four turnovers. And his outside shot hasn’t been falling of late, with Briscoe making just 1 of his last 12 three-pointers. When Briscoe’s at his best, he’s an outstanding complementary player, as someone who’s nearly impossible to keep out of the lane, and he can be among the SEC’s best defenders. Author
